title: Tutorial
text: perform MR analysis body mass index (exposure - ieu--2) coronary heart disease (outcome - ieu--7). Obtain data Obtain metadata create metadata object Construct Summary Sets set tool metadata (uses ieugwasr::gwasinfo() source id arguments) Set MR labels summary sets Check Metadata MR labels Create DataSet object Convert TwoSampleMR format Perform MR analysis
code: x <- ieugwasr::tophits("ieu-a-2")$rsid d1 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-2") d2 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-7") m1 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-2") m2 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-7") meta1 <-create_metadata(m1) meta2 <-create_metadata(m2) sumset1 <- create_summaryset(d1, metadata=meta1) sumset2 <- create_summaryset(d2, metadata=meta2) sumset1 <-setAttributes(sumset1, mr_label = "exposure") sumset2 <-setAttributes(sumset2, mr_label = "outcome") getMetadata(sumset1) getAttributes(sumset1)  getMetadata(sumset2) getAttributes(sumset2) #  create dataset and convert it to mr format summary_sets <- list(sumset1,sumset2)       # create dataset     dataset <- create_dataset(summary_sets, harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1)  %>%     # Convert dataset to TwoSampleMR format    convertForTwoSampleMR(.) mr_result <-  merge(getData(dataset,1),getData(dataset,2), by = c("SNP", "mr_keep"))  %>%   TwoSampleMR::mr(., method_list="mr_ivw")  mr_result

title: Tutorial
text: First, set path reference population plink bed files located build LD matrix define genomic range analysis performed. known LD block chromosome 22 (build hg19) need scan OpenGWAS traits significant associations region obtain metadata trait Finally, create summarysets trait dataset, comprise summarysets. harmonise trait trait followed trait LD matrix. Next, trait need perform finemapping. involve using SusieR identify credible sets region trait, generate conditional summary datasets credible set. Explanation: Credible set: trait inferred e.g. 3 causal variants genomic region 3 credible sets. credible set essentially cluster SNPs close , include 1 SNPs candidates causal variant. Conditional summary datasets: credible sets identified, can try estimate summary data results looked like credible set accounting credible sets. example 3 conditional summary datasets, single peak different location. Use susieR generate credible sets dataset (e.g. 1, 1. least 1 selected association region) TODO: Explain marginalise summarysets using susieR Approximate Bayes Factors. summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Now going merge datasets. Note merge_datasets() function just going merge marginalised datasets. Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. (Use fork hypercoloc allows dataset object provided) Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets NOTE: example colocalisation.
code: #bed_ref <- "/project/data/reference/ld/EUR" bed_ref <- "../data/ld/EUR" genomicrange <- "22:43714200-44995307" id_list <- ieugwasr::phewas(pval = 5e-6, variants=genomicrange, batch="ukb-a")$id %>%   unique() # get metadata and create metadata objects metadata <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){   m <- create_metadata(ieugwasr::gwasinfo(id_list[i]))  }) # create gwasglue2 DataSet object     dataset <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){     # create summarysets     dt <- create_summaryset(ieugwasr::associations(variants = genomicrange, id = id_list[i]), metadata=metadata[[i]])   }) %>%     # create dataset     create_dataset(., harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) %>%      # harmonise dataset against LD matrix     harmonise_ld(., bfile = bed_ref , plink_bin = "plink") # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(dataset) dataset_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(dataset), summaryset = getSummarySet(dataset, trait)) }) dataset_marginalised <- merge_datasets(dataset_marginalised) res_dataset <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset)  #hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input print(res_dataset) res_dataset_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset_marginalised) print(res_dataset_marginalised)

code: # create an harmonised gwasglue2 DataSet object    hmgcr <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     # create summarysets     dt <- create_summaryset(data = ieugwasr::associations(variants = hmgcr_chrpos, id = ids[i]), metadata = metadata[[i]])   }) %>%     # create dataset     create_dataset(., harmonise = FALSE) %>%      # add chd summaryset and harmonise     add_summaryset(hmgcr_chd, ., harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) %>%     # harmonise dataset against LD matrix     harmonise_ld(., bfile = bed_ref , plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (hmgcr) plot_gwasglue(hmgcr, type="manhattan", title = "HMGCR")

title: Tutorial 2: finemapping and colocalisation
text: First, set path reference population plink bed files located build LD matrix define genomic range analysis performed. known LD block chromosome 22 (build hg19) need scan OpenGWAS traits significant associations region obtain metadata trait Finally, create summarysets trait dataset, comprise summarysets. harmonise trait trait followed trait LD matrix. Note dataset created chain multiple operations using pipes. Unlike example Tutorial 1, sumarysets saved separately. Next, trait need perform finemapping. involve using SusieR identify credible sets region trait, generate conditional summary datasets credible set. Explanation: Credible set: trait inferred e.g. 3 causal variants genomic region 3 credible sets. credible set essentially cluster SNPs close , include 1 SNPs candidates causal variant. Conditional summary datasets: credible sets identified, can try estimate summary data results looked like credible set accounting credible sets. example 3 conditional summary datasets, single peak different location. use modified version susieR (use ritarasteiro/susieR fork) reads gwasglue2 dataset generate credible sets summaryset within dataset (e.g. 1, 1. least 1 selected association region) TODO: Explain marginalise summarysets using susieR Approximate Bayes Factors. summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Now going merge datasets. Note merge_datasets() function just going merge marginalised datasets. Try hyprcoloc raw datasets. (Use fork hypercoloc allows dataset object provided) Try hyprcoloc marginalised datasets NOTE: example colocalisation traits IEU batch "ukb-"..
code: bed_ref <- "../data/ld/EUR" genomicrange <- "22:43714200-44995307" id_list <- ieugwasr::phewas(pval = 5e-6, variants=genomicrange, batch="ukb-a")$id %>%   unique() # get metadata and create metadata objects metadata <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){   m <- create_metadata(ieugwasr::gwasinfo(id_list[i]))  }) # create gwasglue2 DataSet object    dataset <- lapply(seq_along(id_list), function(i){     # create summarysets     dt <- create_summaryset(ieugwasr::associations(variants = genomicrange, id = id_list[i]), metadata=metadata[[i]])   }) %>%     # create dataset and harmonise trait againts trait     create_dataset(., harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) %>%      # harmonise dataset against LD matrix     harmonise_ld(., bfile = bed_ref , plink_bin = "plink") # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(dataset) dataset_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(dataset), summaryset = getSummarySet(dataset, trait)) }) dataset_marginalised <- merge_datasets(dataset_marginalised) res_dataset <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset)  #hyprcoloc is using gwasglue2 DataSet class object as input print(res_dataset) res_dataset_marginalised <- hyprcoloc(dataset = dataset_marginalised) print(res_dataset_marginalised)

code: # create an harmonised gwasglue2 DataSet object    hmgcr <- lapply(seq_along(ids), function(i){     # create summarysets     dt <- create_summaryset(data = ieugwasr::associations(variants = hmgcr_chrpos, id = ids[i]), metadata = metadata[[i]])   }) %>%     # create dataset     create_dataset(., harmonise = FALSE) %>%      # add chd summaryset and harmonise     add_summaryset(hmgcr_chd, ., harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1) %>%     # harmonise dataset against LD matrix     harmonise_ld(., bfile = bed_ref , plink_bin = "plink") # plot gwasglue2 DataSet object (hmgcr) plot_gwasglue(hmgcr, type="manhattan", title = "HMGCR")

title: Tutorial 4: finemapping and colocalisation
text: summary sets harmonised, marginalise summary set independently create new dataset marginalised summary sets merged Now going merge datasets. Note merge_datasets() function just going merge marginalised datasets.
code: # do finemapping with susie ntraits <- getLength(hmgcr) hmgcr_marginalised <- lapply(1:ntraits, function(trait)   {     # Takes in 1 SS     # Outputs 1 DS (with at least 1 SS)     ds <- susie_rss(R = getLDMatrix(hmgcr), summaryset = getSummarySet(hmgcr, trait)) }) hmgcr_marginalised <- merge_datasets(hmgcr_marginalised)

title: Tutorial 1: MR analysis
text: perform MR analysis body mass index (exposure - ieu--2) coronary heart disease (outcome - ieu--7). Obtain data Obtain metadata create metadata object Construct Summary Sets set tool metadata (uses ieugwasr::gwasinfo() source id arguments) Set MR labels summary sets Check Metadata MR labels Create DataSet object Convert TwoSampleMR format Perform MR analysis
code: x <- ieugwasr::tophits("ieu-a-2")$rsid d1 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-2") d2 <- ieugwasr::associations(variants = x, id = "ieu-a-7") m1 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-2") m2 <- ieugwasr::gwasinfo( "ieu-a-7") meta1 <-create_metadata(m1) meta2 <-create_metadata(m2) sumset1 <- create_summaryset(d1, metadata=meta1) sumset2 <- create_summaryset(d2, metadata=meta2) sumset1 <-setAttributes(sumset1, mr_label = "exposure") sumset2 <-setAttributes(sumset2, mr_label = "outcome") getMetadata(sumset1) getAttributes(sumset1)  getMetadata(sumset2) getAttributes(sumset2) #  create dataset and convert it to mr format summary_sets <- list(sumset1,sumset2)       # create dataset     dataset <- create_dataset(summary_sets, harmonise = TRUE, tolerance = 0.08, action = 1)  %>%     # Convert dataset to TwoSampleMR format    convertForTwoSampleMR(.) mr_result <-  merge(getData(dataset,1),getData(dataset,2), by = c("SNP", "mr_keep"))  %>%   TwoSampleMR::mr(., method_list="mr_ivw")  mr_result
